form.name: form1

span.div: Gov. Mike DeWine has ordered the closure of public school buildings in Ohio through the end of the 2019-20 academic year in an effort to contain the spread of the COVID-19 Coronavirus. Online instruction for Cloverleaf students began March 30.
In accordance with Ohio House Bill 197, Cloverleaf Board of Education meetings will be held remotely during the COVID-19 outbreak. Information on how to access meetings will be posted here.

ul.li: Preschool screening is postponed until further notice.
The playgrounds at Cloverleaf Elementary School are closed.
Students taking Advanced Placement courses who opt to take corresponding AP exams must sign up by May 22. Please click HERE for more.
All athletic events, practices, and extracurricular activities are postponed.
The Cloverleaf Community Recreation Center is closed until further notice.
All athletic facilities, including the track, are closed until further notice.

span.div: Cloverleaf is providing each student with a week's worth of breakfasts and lunches. They may be picked up every Tuesday from 5:30 to 7:30 p.m. at Cloverleaf Elementary School. If you, your family, or someone you know can use help with meals during the COVID-19 outbreak, local businesses and Feeding Medina County have resources available. Please click HERE for details.

strong.span: + Addiction and Mental Health Support Services

div.a: Please click HERE for information on mental health and substance abuse services, such as prevention and recovery supports, for students, families, and all individuals -- including those at the front lines of this pandemic.

span.div: Chromebooks for online learning may be picked up at Cloverleaf High School on Tuesdays and Thursdays from 9 a.m. to 2 p.m. If you are experiencing problems with your Chromebook, you may bring it in during this time to exchange it. The Cloverleaf technology department is available to staff and students by telephone on weekdays from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. Please call 866-779-7748 for assistance.

li.a: Local Level: Buy Event Tickets & more
Local Level: Buy Event tickets & more
Local Level: Buy Event tickets & more

img.alt: CHS team at JustWrite Ohio competition

span.img: Cloverleaf High School Commencement 2020 is scheduled for Sunday, May 31.

div.span: Our contingency date is Sunday, July 12.
Please save the date and stay tuned for details
What Does School During Quarantine Look Like For You??

div.a: Check out this video! Thanks, Abby!

br.span: All students who take an Advanced Placement course are encouraged to take the corresponding AP exam for that class. Taking AP exams can potentially earn students college credit and/or course advancement in college. While taking AP exams is normally a requirement at CHS, students and their families may opt out for this year, if they choose. Please click HERE for more.

span.p: Cloverleaf's five-year, 2-mill Permanent Improvement Levy is up for renewal. This is NOT a new tax and will not increase property taxes. The PI levy pays for items with a life expectancy of five years or more, such as buses, computers, textbooks and security upgrades. It does not pay for staff salaries. Please click HERE to learn more.

span.style: background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: The Ohio Legislature has extended absentee voting by mail until April 28. There will be no in-person voting. Vote by mail ballots must be requested by April 25. They need to be postmarked by April 27 or returned to the Medina County Board of Elections by April 28. For details,

span.style: background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

a.span: please click HERE to visit the board of elections website

span.style: background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

span.div: If you, your family, or someone you know can use help with meals during the COVID-19 outbreak, local businesses, Feeding Medina County, and Cloverleaf Schools all have resources available. We will get though this together!

img.title: Football play
img.alt: Coach Vorhies authors article for football site

div.span: Coach Vorhies authors article for football site

br.span: Congratulations to CHS Head Football Coach Justin Vorhies, who recently had an article published by the football research company X&O Labs about the new offensive scheme that has led the Colts to school records in total yards and scoring. Click HERE to read more.

Will your child be 5 years old before Aug. 1, 2020? If so, we are looking forward to welcoming him or her to the Cloverleaf family! Please click HERE to learn how to register your child for kindergarten for the 2020-21 school year.

Cloverleaf contracted with the research firm Futuristics to conduct a scientifically based survey in September 2019 to gauge the community's opinion on how potential tax revenues generated by the NEXUS pipeline should be utilized by the school district. Please click HERE to read the survey results.

a.title:
Families receive a bag with five days of breakfasts and a bag with five days of lunches for each Cloverleaf student. Distribution is drive-through style and is held at Cloverleaf Elementary School. Meals are prepared by food service staff and volunteers. Please use the north driveway off Friendsville Road. Staff and volunteers will take down the names of the Cloverleaf students the food is intended to serve and load the food into your car.
Location: Cloverleaf Elementary School Starting at: 5:30 PM Ending at: 7:30 PM
